places.name: Praia do Futuro
places.description: Famous for its beachfront 'barracas' (kiosks/restaurants) and regional cuisine, especially crab.

places.name: Centro Dragão do Mar
places.address: R. Dragão do Mar, Fortaleza - CE
places.description: A large cultural complex featuring museums, a cinema, theaters, and a lively nightlife.

places.name: Avenida Beira Mar (Meireles Beach)
places.description: The main urban beachfront avenue, famous for the daily handicraft fair and sunset views.

places.name: Mercado Central de Fortaleza
places.address: Av. Alberto Nepomuceno, 199 - Centro, Fortaleza - CE
places.description: A large indoor market with hundreds of stalls selling local crafts, clothing, hammocks, and regional products.

places.name: Theatro José de Alencar
places.address: R. Conde D'Eu, 230 - Centro, Fortaleza - CE
places.description: An impressive and historic theater known for its stunning Art Nouveau architecture and cultural programming.

places.name: Catedral Metropolitana de Fortaleza
places.address: Praça da Sé - Centro, Fortaleza - CE
places.description: A striking neo-Gothic cathedral, one of the largest in Brazil, located in the historic city center.

places.name: Ponte dos Ingleses (English Bridge) / Espigão de Iracema
places.description: A pier popular for watching the sunset and spotting dolphins, offering a great view of the city skyline.

places.name: Praia de Mucuripe
places.description: Known for the traditional jangadas (sail rafts) and the Fish Market, a great spot for fresh seafood.

places.name: Beach Park (Porto das Dunas)
places.address: R. Porto das Dunas, 2734 - Porto das Dunas, Aquiraz - CE
places.description: Located near Fortaleza, this is one of Latin America's largest and most famous aquatic parks, featuring the 'Insano' slide.

places.name: Parque Estadual do Cocó
places.address: Av. Padre Antônio Tomás, S/N - Cocó, Fortaleza - CE
places.description: Fortaleza's largest urban park, an important ecological reserve with trails, boat rides, and recreational areas.
